PolicyDefinitions.name: Authorization Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Enables fine grained authorization to API resources based on authenticated user roles.

templates.template: Appropriate authorization roles are required.  There are ${rules.size()} authorization rules defined.

PolicyDefinitions.name: BASIC Authentication Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Enables HTTP BASIC Authentication on an API.  Some configuration required.

templates.template: Access to the API is protected by BASIC Authentication through the '${realm}' authentication realm.  @if{forwardIdentityHttpHeader != null}Successfully authenticated requests will forward the authenticated identity to the back end API via the '${forwardIdentityHttpHeader}' custom HTTP header.@end{}

PolicyDefinitions.name: Caching Resources Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Allows caching of API responses in the Gateway to reduce overall traffic to the back-end API.

templates.template: API responses will be cached for @{ttl} seconds.

PolicyDefinitions.name: IP Blacklist Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Requests that originate from a specified set of valid IP addresses will be denied access.

templates.template: Requests that originate from the set of ${ipList.size()} configured IP address(es) will be denied access to the managed API.

PolicyDefinitions.name: IP Whitelist Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Only requests that originate from a specified set of valid IP addresses will be allowed through.

templates.template: Only requests that originate from the set of ${ipList.size()} configured IP address(es) will be allowed to invoke the managed API.

PolicyDefinitions.name: Ignored Resources Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Requests satisfying the provided regular expression will be ignored.

templates.template: Requests matching any of the ${rules.size()} regular expressions provided will receive a 404 error code.

PolicyDefinitions.name: Quota Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Provides a way to limit the total number of requests that can be sent to an API.

templates.template: Consumers cannot exceed their quota of ${limit} requests per ${granularity} per ${period}.

PolicyDefinitions.name: Rate Limiting Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Enforces rate configurable request rate limits on an API.  This ensures that consumers can't overload an API with too many requests.

templates.template: Consumers are limited to ${limit} requests per ${granularity} per ${period}.

PolicyDefinitions.name: Time Restricted Access Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Requests matching the specified regular expression and made within the specified time period will be ignored.

templates.template: Requests matching the regular expression and made outside the specified time period will receive a 423 error code.

PolicyDefinitions.name: Transfer Quota Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Provides a way to limit the total number of bytes that can be transferred from (or to) an API.

templates.template: Consumers are limited to transferring ${limit} bytes per ${granularity} per ${period}.

PolicyDefinitions.name: URL Rewriting Policy
PolicyDefinitions.description: Responses from the back-end API will be modified by fixing up any incorrect URLs found with modified ones.  This is useful because apiman works through an API Gateway.

templates.template: Requests and/or responses will be modified by finding all text matching regular expression '${fromRegex}' with '${toReplacement}'.
